title: BBB’s New Valor Sunglasses Deliver High Contrast with FLUX Lenses
content:
Another contender in the mid-priced eyewear market, Denmark’s BBB has just announced new discipline-specific FLUX lenses alongside a new Valor sunglass model. If you’re not familiar with BBB, they’ve been producing bike components, accessories and cycling apparel since 1998.

BBB’s FLUX lenses are a new offering that provides four different options for high-contrast, color-tuned optics. Three of the models are specifically ideal for road, MTB, or gravel riding, and the fourth is an all-conditions lens. The new FLUX lenses are available on BBB’s existing Chester sunglasses and the brand-new Valor model.

FLUX Lenses:

BBB’s most advanced lens to date, the FLUX lenses filter out non-essential wavelengths of red, green, and blue light to improve clarity and increase contrast. This helps your eyes perceive details, differentiate between colors, and experience less fatigue. The lenses allow for bright, high-contrast vision in all conditions, but there are four specific tints that cater to different riding styles.  

The FLUX lenses also provide 100% UV-A and UV-B protection, plus they filter harmful blue light and infrared light.

Both sides of the lenses are protected with an anti-scratch coating. The outside of the lens also gets an oleophobic coating to resist water, mud, and dust. An anti-fog treatment on the inside of the lens helps fight off condensation.

The new FLUX lenses are available on the new Valor sunglasses and BBB’s updated Chester sunglasses. There are four different FLUX lenses available for road, MTB, gravel, and all-around riding:

FLUX Red: Intended for road riding, this lens allows 16.8% light transmission. The red lens filters out warm tones to enhance contrast on asphalt and cobblestones. It is suitable for sunny or cloudy conditions.

FLUX Blue: Providing the most color enhancement of all the options, the FLUX Blue lens is ideal for gravel riders. This lens increases contrast on dirt pathways and works well for sunny or shady rides with a light transmission of 14.6%. 

FLUX Green: Mountain bikers should opt for the green lens; which maximizes contrast from brown and yellow hues. This makes it easier to see roots, rocks, and trail surfaces. The lens also boosts green tones to separate the forest from the open trail ahead. The green lens allows 16% light transmission.

FLUX Pure: If you want one pair of sunglasses that work well anywhere, the FLUX Pure lens is your all-conditions option. This lens enhances contrast to reduce eye strain for any type of rider. At 12.5% light transmission it is ideal for brighter rides but isn’t too dark for overcast conditions or shady forest patches.

Valor FLUX Sunglasses:

The new Valor sunglasses feature a half-frame design. The frames are made of Rilsan™ G850, a bio-based Nylon produced from castor beans. The material is flexible and strong and can be produced sustainably.

The Valor lens features a small vent at the top to combat condensation buildup. To ensure a solid fit, the frames offer slightly curved arms, rubberized temple grippers, and an adjustable nosepiece. Weight is listed at 30g.

The Valor FLUX model comes with a clear lens and a FLUX lens, plus a hard case and soft pouch.  MSRP is €129. Frame color options are Matt Black, Light Grey, or Transparent Green.

Chester FLUX:

BBB’s most popular unisex eyewear model, the Chester is a full-frame sunglass that has been updated with an improved temple design and new FLUX lens options. The Chester frames are also made from bio-based Rilsan™ G850, and the nose piece is adjustable.

The Chester FLUX retails for €89.99, and includes a spare clear lens, hard case, and soft pouch. Lens options are FLUX Red or FLUX Blue, and frame color options are Matt Black or Gloss Black.

BBB products are not distributed in the USA but are sold across Europe and the Middle East, plus in Australia and Canada.
